solution_line_template: The total cost for the legos are {num_lego} x ${price_lego} = $<<{num_lego}*{price_lego}={total_lego}>>{total_lego}.
The total cost for the toy swords is {num_sword} x ${price_sword} = $<<{num_sword}*{price_sword}={total_sword}>>{total_sword}.
The total cost for the play doughs is {num_dough} x ${price_dough} = $<<{num_dough}*{price_dough}={total_dough}>>{total_dough}.
Therefore the total cost for everything is ${total_lego} + ${total_sword} + ${total_dough} = $<<{total_lego}+{total_sword}+{total_dough}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
